content.description:
Traverse the brick face from right to left as the wall steadily gets larger. Staying on the 1.5" footrail will get tougher. After making it through the first brick section, hop onto the main rock of the bridge, and climb across "

Concrete Jug Jungle

" for one long traverse. You get bonus points for topping it out using the wide crack in the dihedral after the concrete lip traverse.

Mega...get your ARCing on.
content.protection: None, a pad for the concrete if you blow some easy, rail campusing.
content.location: At the Euclid/Broadway Bridge Underpass, start closer to the bus stop on the side farthest from the UMC.

content.description: This route climbs horizontally across the ever-so-arching, concrete, roof side of the underpass that is Broadway and Euclid. There's 2 of these, but they are quite the same. Although positive, it's usually a bit dirty and hard to keep ahold of. This is a good warm-up!
content.protection: Just campus it, and you'll be fine.
content.location: It is just SW of the UMC...under Broadway.
